verses.text: 所羅門宣告建殿的理由那時所羅門說：「耶和華曾說他要住在幽暗之中。

words.note: Verb-object compound: build a temple
Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Book of 1 Kings)
Often implies a mysterious or profound darkness.
Formal equivalent of 在...裡/中

verses.text: 我已經為你建造了巍峨的殿宇，作你永遠居住的地方。」

words.note: Often used to describe grand buildings or mountains.

verses.text: 然後王轉過來，給以色列全體會眾祝福，以色列全體會眾都站著。

words.note: 站 (stand) + 著 (aspect particle indicating continuous state)

verses.text: 所羅門說：「耶和華以色列的 神是應當稱頌的！他親口對我的父親大衛應許的，已親手作成了，他說：

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence for the divine name.
To speak highly of; often used for praising God.
Often refers to God's divine promises in a religious context.
Turns a verb phrase into a noun phrase, e.g., 'that which was promised'.
Short form of 已經 (yǐjīng)

verses.text: 『自從我領我的子民從埃及地出來的那天，我沒有在以色列眾支派中，揀選一座城建造殿宇，使我的名留在那裡；我也沒有揀選一個人作領袖，統治我的子民以色列。

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people.
埃及 (Egypt) is a transliteration, 地 (dì) means land/earth.
Used to denote plurality, similar to 'all the' or 'many'.
Refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 我卻揀選了耶路撒冷，使我的名留在那裡；也揀選了大衛，統治我的子民以色列。』

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
In biblical context, 'name' often represents character or presence.
Refers to the people as 'children' or 'offspring' of God/a ruler.

verses.text: 我的父親大衛有心要為耶和華以色列的 神的名建造殿宇。

words.note: Lit. 'have heart/mind'.
Capitalized as a proper name for God in this context.
Refers to a grand building, specifically a temple in religious texts.

verses.text: 耶和華卻對我的父親大衛說：『你心想要為我的名建造殿宇，你心意很好；

words.note: Lit. 'heart thinks'.
Lit. 'heart's meaning'.

verses.text: 不過不是由你建造殿宇，而是你的兒子，你親生的兒子，他必為我的名建殿。』

words.note: Verb-object compound: build a temple.

verses.text: 現在耶和華實現了他的應許，我已經起來接續我的父親大衛，坐上了以色列的王位，就像耶和華所說的；我為耶和華以色列的 神的名建造了這殿。

words.note: A grammatical particle marking a passive or nominalized verb.

verses.text: 我也把約櫃安放在殿裡，約櫃中有耶和華和以色列人所立的約。」

words.note: A sacred chest containing the tablets of the Ten Commandments.
The personal name of God in the Old Testament.
People of Israel; often refers to descendants of Jacob.

verses.text: 所羅門獻殿的禱告所羅門在以色列全體會眾面前，站在耶和華的祭壇前，張開雙手；

words.note: Abbreviation for 列王紀上 (Book of 1 Kings).

verses.text: 原來所羅門做了一座銅臺，長兩公尺兩公寸，寬兩公尺兩公寸，高一公尺三公寸，安放在外院中。那時他站在銅臺上，在以色列全體會眾面前，屈膝下跪，向天張開雙手，
說：「耶和華以色列的 神啊，天上地下沒有神可以和你相比的，你向那些一心行在你面前的僕人，常是守約施慈愛的；

words.note: A blank space used in some Bibles before God's name for reverence.

words.definition: to not have, there is not

words.note: Refers to God's steadfast love and faithfulness.

verses.text: 你對你的僕人我父親大衛所應許的，你都遵守了，你親口應許，也親手成全，就像今日一樣。
耶和華以色列的 神啊，你應許你的僕人我父親大衛說：『只要你的子孫謹守他們的行為，遵守我的律法，像你在我面前所行的一樣，你就不會斷人在我面前坐上以色列的王位。』現在求你應驗這話吧。

words.note: Expresses exclamation or question.
所 (suǒ) nominalizes the following verb, referring to 'that which was done'.
Indicates suggestion, request, or mild command.

verses.text: 耶和華以色列的 神啊，現在求你實現你向你的僕人大衛應許的話吧！

words.note: Expresses exclamation or question.
Used here as an adjective modifying '話'.
Indicates suggestion, request, or mild command.

verses.text: 「 神真的要和人住在地上嗎？看哪，天和天上的天也容不下你，何況我建造的這殿呢？

words.note: Forms a yes-no question.
An exclamation used to draw attention.
Refers to the highest heaven, 'heaven of heavens'.
Indicates a rhetorical question or asks for confirmation.

verses.text: 耶和華我的 神啊，求你垂注你僕人的禱告和祈求，聆聽你僕人在你面前所發的呼喊和禱告。

words.note: Expresses exclamation or address.
Implies a superior 'bending down' to pay attention, often used for God's graciousness.
所 (suǒ) nominalizes the following verb, referring to 'that which is uttered'.

verses.text: 求你張開眼睛，晝夜看顧這殿，就是看顧你所說要立你名的地方；求你垂聽你僕人向著這地方所發的禱告。

words.note: Common phrase in biblical texts signifying continuous action.
所 (suǒ) nominalizes the following verb, referring to 'that which was said'.
Implies God's gracious condescension to listen to prayers.
所 (suǒ) nominalizes the following verb, referring to 'that which is uttered'.

verses.text: 求你垂聽你的僕人和你的子民以色列的祈求，就是他們向著這地方所發的禱告；求你從天上，從你的居所垂聽，垂聽和赦免。

words.note: Implies God's condescending listening to humans.
Refers to God's chosen people.
Indicates a passive construction or 'what is done'.
Implies God's condescending listening to humans.
Implies God's condescending listening to humans.

verses.text: 「人若是得罪了鄰舍，有人要他起誓，他就來到這殿，在你的祭壇前起誓；
求你從天上垂聽，施行你的作為，審判你的僕人，照著惡人所行的報應在他頭上；宣告義人無罪，照著他的義行賞賜他。

words.note: Implies God's condescending listening to humans.
Indicates a passive construction or 'what is done'.

verses.text: 「如果你的子民以色列得罪了你，以致在仇敵面前被擊敗；後來回心轉意，承認你的名，在這殿裡向你禱告祈求，

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 求你從天上垂聽，赦免你子民以色列的罪，領他們歸回你賜給他們和他們列祖的土地。

words.note: Implies God's condescending listening to humans.
Refers to God's chosen people.

verses.text: 「你的子民因得罪了你，你懲罰他們，使天閉塞不下雨；如果他們向著這地方禱告，承認你的名，離開他們的罪，

words.note: Lit. 'to incur sin/offense'
Often refers to divine authority/character in biblical context.

verses.text: 求你在天上垂聽，赦免你的僕人和你的子民以色列的罪，把他們當行的正道指教他們，降雨在你的地上，就是你賜給你的子民作產業的地上。

words.note: Forms '天上' (in heaven)

words.definition: to listen attentively, condescend to hear
words.note: Lit. 'to let down ears and listen'
Forms '地上' (on the land)
Often implies a superior granting something to an inferior.
Forms '地上' (on the land)

verses.text: 「國中若是有饑荒、瘟疫、旱風、霉爛、蝗蟲、螞蚱，或是有仇敵圍困城鎮，或是有甚麼災禍，甚麼疾病，

words.note: Refers to a wind that causes crops to wither.

verses.text: 你的子民以色列，無論是個別或是全體，自知自己的災禍和痛苦，向著這殿張開雙手禱告或祈求，

words.definition: to know oneself, to be aware

verses.text: 求你從天上你的居所垂聽和赦免他們，你是知道人心的，你必照著各人所行的報應各人；因為只有你知道世人的心。

words.note: Forms '天上' (in heaven)

words.definition: to listen attentively, condescend to hear
words.note: Lit. 'to let down ears and listen'

verses.text: 使他們在你賜給我們列祖的地上，一生一世敬畏你，遵行你的道路。

words.note: Commonly used for God's giving.
Often combined with location nouns like '地' (dì) to mean 'on the land'.
An idiom emphasizing duration.
Often used in the context of reverent fear towards God.

verses.text: 「至於在你的子民以色列以外的外族人，他們為了你的大名、你大能的手和伸出來的膀臂，從遠方而來；他們來向著這殿禱告的時候，

words.note: Refers to God's chosen people.
Refers to non-Israelite peoples.
Refers to God's fame and reputation.
Often describes God's power.
Often used in scripture as a metaphor for power.
Refers to the temple of God.

verses.text: 求你從天上，從你的居所垂聽他們，照著外族人向你呼求的一切而行，使地上萬民都認識你的名，敬畏你，像你的子民以色列一樣；又使他們知道我建造的這殿，是奉為你名的所在。

words.note: Often combined with location nouns like '天' (tiān) to mean 'in heaven'.
Refers to God's habitation.
Implies God's gracious attention to prayers.
Often combined with location nouns like '地' (dì) to mean 'on the earth'.
To respectfully designate something as.

verses.text: 「如果你的子民在你派他們出去的路上，和仇敵作戰，他們向著你揀選的這城，和向著我為你的名建造的這殿向你禱告，

words.definition: on the way, on the road

verses.text: 求你從天上垂聽他們的禱告祈求，使他們得勝。

words.note: Often combined with location nouns like '天' (tiān) to mean 'in heaven'.

verses.text: 「如果你的子民得罪了你（因為世上沒有不犯罪的人），你向他們發怒，把他們交在仇敵面前，以致仇敵把他們擄到外地或遠或近；

words.note: Refers to a nation's people or subjects.
To incur a sin or offense.
Verb-object compound meaning 'to commit sin'.

words.definition: so that, with the result that

verses.text: 如果他們在被擄去的地方回心轉意，在被擄去的地方祈求你說：『我們犯了罪了，我們作了孽了，我們行了惡了。』

words.note: Indicates removal or going away.
Idiom literally 'turn heart, change mind'.
Structure: V + 了 + O. '犯罪' is a compound verb 'commit sin'.
Structure: V + 了 + O. '作孽' is a compound verb 'do evil'.
Structure: V + 了 + O. '行惡' is a compound verb 'do evil'.

verses.text: 如果他們在被擄去的地方一心一意歸向你，又向著他們自己的地，就是你賜給他們列祖的地，和向著你揀選的這城，以及向著我為你的名建造的這殿禱告，

words.note: Idiom literally 'one heart, one mind'.
Refers to a fortified city.
Verb-object compound meaning 'to make a prayer'.

verses.text: 求你從天上，從你的居所垂聽他們的禱告祈求，為他們伸冤，赦免得罪了你的那些子民。

words.note: Implies respectful or gracious listening from a superior.
Can be a verb or noun: 'to pray' or 'a prayer'.

verses.text: 「我的 神啊，現在求你張開眼睛，求你的耳朵垂聽在這地方獻上的禱告。

words.note: The leading space indicates reverence for God in some Chinese Bibles.

verses.text: 現在，耶和華 神啊，求你起來，願你和你有大能的約櫃進入你安息的地方；耶和華 神啊，願你的祭司都披上救恩；願你的聖民在福樂中歡欣。

words.note: A respectful appellation for God, common in CUV Old Testament.
Often used to express a strong wish or prayer.
Commonly describes God's attributes or powerful acts in the Bible.
Often used in religious contexts regarding divine or eternal rest.
A respectful appellation for God, common in CUV Old Testament.
Often used to express a strong wish or prayer.
Often used to express a strong wish or prayer.
A literary term for happiness and blessedness, common in religious texts.
Often used with '在' to form '在...中' (in the midst of...).
More formal or literary than '高興' (gāoxìng).

verses.text: 耶和華 神啊，求你不要轉臉不顧你所膏的人：願你記念你向你僕人大衛所施的慈愛。」

words.note: A respectful appellation for God, common in CUV Old Testament.
Literally 'turn face', used figuratively to mean 'ignore' or 'disregard'.
Forms a nominalized phrase with a verb, e.g., '所V的N' (the N that is Ved).
Often used to express a strong wish or prayer.
Forms a nominalized phrase with a verb, e.g., '所V的N' (the N that is Ved).
A theological term for God's steadfast love and mercy.
